definition: to cause one (to do sth)/to make one (angry, delighted etc)
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)
to make one's hair stand up in anger (idiom); to raise people's hackles

sentences.english: His approach is both innovative and thought-provoking.
sentences.chinese: 他的方法是创新的和令人深思的。

sentences.english: The police report described, in horrifying detail, the nightmare that followed.
sentences.chinese: 警方卷宗描述了接下来发生的噩梦，令人战栗的细节。

sentences.english: It's one of the most haunting and complex sounds in the animal kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 这是动物王国中最为复杂，最令人难以忘怀的音乐。

sentences.english: This is an intersting job, but kind of dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 这是一项令人兴奋的工作，但有几分危险。

sentences.english: It was a haunting vision, the past compellingly present.
sentences.chinese: 这是一幅令人难以忘怀的景象，过去分明就在眼前。

sentences.english: In the past seven years, we've also seen images that have sobered us.
sentences.chinese: 在过去七年时间里，我们也看到令人警醒的画面。

sentences.english: Unsolicited advice is perceived as annoying. Don’t do it.
sentences.chinese: 未经请求的建议也会令人讨厌，所以不要那么做。

sentences.english: Its shadows are an ambush, its lights a surprise .
sentences.chinese: 它的阴影象伏兵千万，它的光泽令人惊异。
“它们是令人惊异的动物，”罗宾逊说。

sentences.english: Thickness and quality of the glass are impressive.
sentences.chinese: 透镜的厚度和质量令人印象深刻。

sentences.english: Unique combination of real time strategy with turn-based strategy, wonderful graphic, exciting gameplay allow you to feel yourself a real world ruler.
sentences.chinese: 令人激动的游戏让你认为自己是一个现实世界统治者。

sentences.english: One Wow to the good life.
sentences.chinese: 一个能让人过上幸福生活的令人惊奇的诀窍。

sentences.english: We’ve all heard about the Earth’s temperature rising at an alarming rate.
sentences.chinese: 我们都听说了地球的温度在以令人担忧的速度上升。

sentences.english: But such myopia is also deeply regrettable.
sentences.chinese: 但这样的近视也令人深感遗憾。

sentences.english: W2: The exciting atmosphere of change and development.
sentences.chinese: 那令人振奋的巨变和发展氛围。

sentences.english: The dampness is unpleasant , not to mention the cold .
sentences.chinese: 潮湿就令人不快，更不必说寒冷了。

definition: classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)
to feel even more/to be extremely (sad, lonely, delighted etc)
to feel/to sense/to have the feeling that/to think that/to move/to affect
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
indeed/truly/(coll.) (used to express disapproval, annoyance etc about sth)
thought-provoking/worth thinking over/to provide food for thought
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
to provoke (esp. annoyance, disgust etc)/to offend/to attract (attention)
